v.v: My spirit is consumed, and my days are over;
Surely there are mockers with me;

v: the grave is ready for me.
my eye must always see their provocation.

v.v: Give now a pledge, be a guarantee for me with yourself;
For you, God, have kept their hearts from understanding;
He who denounces his friends for a reward,

v: who else is there who will help me?
therefore, you will not exalt them over me.
the eyes of his children will fail.

v.v: But he has made me a byword of the people;
My eye is also dim because of sorrow;
Upright men will be stunned by this;
The righteous man will keep to his way;
But as for you all, come on now;
My days are past; my plans are shattered,
These people, these mockers, change the night into day;
If the only home I hope for is Sheol;
and if I have said to the pit, ‘You are my father,’
Will hope go down with me to the gates of Sheol

v: all my body parts are as thin as shadows.
the innocent man will stir himself up against godless men.
he who has clean hands will grow stronger and stronger.
I will not find a wise man among you.
and so are the desires of my heart.
and if I have spread my couch in the darkness;
and to the worm, ‘You are my mother or my sister,’
As for my hope, who can see any?
when we descend to the dust?”
